data.title: The Best Movie Birthday Party Ideas
data.meta_description: Grab your popcorn and settle in! Here are our favorite movie birthday party ideas fit for a star.
data.text:
The thought of hosting the perfect birthday party is daunting for any parent. Why not go easy on yourself (and give the kids a serious treat) with a movie night? All you need is a great film and popcorn to make the night special. Up the fun factor by moving the show outdoors for a movie night under the stars.

We’ve gathered some of our favorite movie birthday party ideas to keep all the fun without the added stress. From personalized ticket invitations to DIY snack caddies, you’ll have everything you need for a star-studded event.

Movie-Themed Invitations

This is the trailer for your epic movie night, so have fun and go for it. Look for silly, bright colors for little ones or elegant, Hollywood-style looks for older kids.

Want to go the DIY route? Break out the construction paper and make Admit One tickets for each of your guests. Include all of the party details and add some gold star confetti for a finishing touch.

Need a cute invite in a hurry? Skip the DIY and download one of these gorgeous invitations to print at home.

This sweet pink invitation features strings of white lights and is perfect for an outdoor movie night.

Movie nights are all about the snacks, so feature them on these fun Admit One tickets full of popcorn and soda.

Invite friends over for a movie under the stars with this simple invitation full of happy colors.

Movie-Themed Decorations

via JustAddConfetti/etsy.comIt’s time to transform your home or backyard into a plush movie theater experience. If you’re hosting an outdoor movie night, keep it simple with a few strands of twinkling lights and plenty of pillows and blankets. If you want to turn things up a notch, go all out with movie night decorations like a red carpet, gold balloons and tickets for each guest. Add some fun touches like a director’s clapboard or old-fashioned popcorn maker to really make a statement.

Here are a few pieces of movie decor to add to your list. Spoiler alert: Once you start creating the theater of your dreams, you may never want to take them down.

Break out the popcorn! This colorful banner brightens up any room and can be reused later for your next movie night or circus-themed party.

Help your guests really make an entrance with this Hollywood red carpet. Strut your stuff past the paparazzi and sneak in through the VIP door.

Don’t forget the snacks! If you’re the DIY type, make your own caddy of movie treats including bottled water or soda, candy and popcorn.

Check out these DIY birthday decorations for any theme.

How to Make a DIY Movie Snack Caddy

Your little guests will love having their very own assortment of all their favorite movie treats. And hey, maybe it will cut down on the mess at the end of the night? Fingers crossed!

What You’ll Need:

Cardboard caddy

Bottled water or soda

Movie candy

Popcorn

12-inch scrapbook paper

Scissors

Using sharp scissors, cut each square of scrapbook paper in half diagonally. Curl each half into a cone and secure with tape.

Repeat making the cones until you have enough for each caddy. Fill them with popcorn or candy.

Place the cones in the caddies and add a mini bottle of water. You’re ready for the show!

Movie-Themed Birthday Party Food

It wouldn’t be a movie night without a feast of salty, crunchy goodness. Break out the old favorites and add a few twists on the classics as well.

Snack Foods

Taste of Home

We all have our go-to movie snacks, so create a little buffet to have something for everyone. Set out a variety of popcorn flavors like classic butter, cheddar and spicy nacho. Movie theater pretzel rods and soft beer pretzel nuggets are always a hit, and satisfy any serious hunger pangs with the best sausage pizza.

Birthday Party Desserts

via BirdInACageCreations/etsy.com

To satisfy everyone’s sweet tooth, add some fun movie candy like caramel cookie candy to your snack buffet. If you can’t imagine a movie night without Raisinettes, mix up a batch of chocolate-covered raisin cookies for easy munching. Think sweet popcorn treats like caramel corn or peanut butter lover’s popcorn. And no need for a cake; whip up a batch of vanilla cupcakes topped with mini yellow marshmallows for an adorable popcorn-themed treat. Top with a mini-clapperboard!

Movie Party Games & Activities

Keep your little moviegoers entertained with plenty of games and activities. While everyone will be looking forward to the main event, don’t put the movie on right away. It’s best to wear out little ones with some fun games and crafts first. Then serve the snacks when you start the movie for a relaxed movie screening without too much squirming.

Food Fun

vgajic/Getty Images

Did someone say popcorn taste test? To set up a tasting station, place a variety of popcorn flavors in small bowls or paper cones and ask your guests to rate their favorites. Or provide plain popcorn and plenty of seasonings to inspire creativity. Checkout these flavored popcorn ideas for inspiration. Older kids will love helping you make popcorn and choosing their own spices.

Movie Party Games

via BlizzyBingo/etsy.com

Break the ice with some fun games that include everyone at the party. Little ones will love movie bingo or charades. Include their favorite animated movies and characters and let them use their imaginations. For the older kids, challenge them with movie night trivia. Make up your own or grab this movie quiz pack from Quizzology.

Showtime!

vgajic/Getty Images

Move the fun outdoors with an outdoor movie projector. Hang a screen from your garage or house and transform your backyard into a magical show under the stars. More outdoor movie night ideas include plenty of comfy blankets and pillows, as well as plenty of snacks. Ask your guests to bring their sleeping bags and a favorite stuffed animal for a little piece of home.

Movie Party Favors

Who doesn’t love leaving a party with a little goody bag? Send your guests off in style with a fun, movie-themed memento to remember the night.

Your guests are probably popcorned out, so delight them with one of these fun surprises:

The best part of any movie is the snacks. Put together a little bag of movie candy and attach a star cutout with each guest’s name.

Lights, camera, action! Leave a basket of novelty clapboards near the door for guests to grab on their way out.

Everyone’s a winner when you pass out Oscar-style trophies at the end of the party. Just brace yourself for the speeches!
